intro: Psychotria insidens, commonly known as the insidious psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to greenish-white flowers. It produces berries that are typically red when mature, containing seeds that are dispersed by animals. Psychotria insidens is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
